steps.content:
Career counselling is extremely important for new moms who are planning to return to work after taking time off to raise their children. Many moms face challenges when trying to re-enter the workforce, and career counselling can provide them with the guidance and support they need to navigate this transition successfully.

### Map out the Pathway

One of the main benefits of career counselling for new moms is that it helps them figure out what steps they need to take to get employed again. Returning to work after being at home can be overwhelming, and career counselling can provide moms with a clear roadmap on how to update their skills, improve their resume, and find job opportunities that align with their interests and schedule.

### Explore Options

Another important aspect of career counselling for new moms is helping them explore different career options. Sometimes, the job they had before becoming a mom may no longer fit their new schedule or provide enough income to cover childcare expenses. A career counsellor can help moms identify new career paths that align with their skills, interests, and lifestyle, ensuring that they make informed decisions about their future.

### Networking Opportunities

Career counselling can provide new moms with valuable networking opportunities. Many jobs are filled through informal networks, and career counsellors can help moms leverage their contacts and connections to find job openings. By letting friends and other contacts know that they are planning to go back to work, new moms can increase their chances of finding suitable employment.

### Emotional Support

Career counselling can provide emotional support to new moms during this transition. Returning to work after being at home with their children can be emotionally challenging, and career counsellors can provide a safe space for moms to express their concerns, fears, and anxieties. They can offer guidance on how to balance work and family responsibilities, manage stress, and maintain a healthy work-life balance.

steps.content:
Finding the right career counselor can be a daunting task, but it is essential for getting the guidance and support you need to make informed career decisions. Here are some steps to help you find the best career counselor for your needs.

### Research

First, do your research. Start by browsing online directories, websites, and reading reviews and testimonials. This will give you an idea of the qualifications and experience of different career counselors. You can also ask for recommendations from friends, family, colleagues, or mentors who have used career counseling services before.

### Consider Methods and Tools

When comparing your options, consider the methods and tools that the career counselors use to help their clients. Some counselors may use personality and skills assessments, while others may focus on one-on-one conversations. Think about what approach would work best for you and align with your goals.

### Figure our Expenditures

It's also important to consider the fees and duration of the counseling sessions. Some career counselors may offer free or discounted initial consultations, while others may have a set fee structure. Make sure to inquire about this before making a decision.

### Choose Suitable Format

Location and format are other factors to consider. Some career counselors may offer in-person sessions, while others may provide counseling services online or over the phone. Think about what format would be most convenient for you and fit into your schedule.

### Prepare Questions

When you have identified potential career counseling services, reach out to them for more information. Prepare a list of questions to ask, such as their approach to career counseling, how they assess clients' needs and goals, and what outcomes and benefits they offer. Pay attention to how they communicate with you and if they listen to your concerns.

### Free Trials 

To get a better sense of whether a career counseling service is right for you, consider trying a sample session. Many counselors offer free or discounted initial consultations where you can meet them and discuss your situation. This will give you a chance to see if you feel comfortable and motivated working with them. After trying a sample session, weigh the pros and cons of each career counseling service based on your criteria, goals, and experience. Trust your intuition and feelings, as they can provide valuable insights into how compatible you are with the counselor and the service.

Once you have made your decision, contact the career counseling service to confirm your booking, payment, and schedule. Be prepared to commit to the process and follow the counselor's guidance and advice. Remember, finding the right career counselor is an important step towards achieving your career goals.

Returning to work after taking a break to focus on motherhood can be challenging for many parents. However, there are several resources available to support individuals in this transition. 

### Path Forward

One such resource is Path Forward, a nonprofit organization that creates "returnships" for women who have been away from the workforce. They work with companies to provide internships for adults, helping women learn new skills and connect with job opportunities.

### Ellevate

Ellevate is another valuable resource for mothers looking to reenter the workforce. It is a dynamic community that connects women across industries for mentorship, advice, and networking opportunities. Ellevate has local chapters and offers a daily newsletter and regular meetups, providing support both online and offline.

### ReacHIRE

ReacHIRE is an organization that believes a career break shouldn't be a career breaker. They provide professional training, coaching, peer support, and paid projects to help women transition back into the workforce. They work to reduce the stigma around working motherhood and connect women with job opportunities.

### The Second Shift

The Second Shift is a platform that pairs women with temporary or project-based opportunities with major companies. They use an algorithm to match women with opportunities that align with their expertise and interests. The Second Shift handles the details of invoicing and payment, providing support throughout the process.

### Simplr
Simplr is a platform that connects remote workers with companies that have customer service needs. This is a great option for mothers who want to work from home and have flexibility in their schedules. Simplr uses AI technology to provide training and support for customer service best practices.

These resources offer valuable support and opportunities for mothers looking to return to the workforce. They provide training, networking, and job placement services to help make the transition smoother and more successful. With the help of these resources, mothers can navigate the challenges of balancing motherhood and work and find fulfilling career opportunities.
